core

Class KeyTyped

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.UserAction
      • core.KeyTyped

  • public class KeyTyped
extends UserAction
    Listen for a certain key and if it's typed calls Behavior.update(). Can be created by behaviors using UserActionFactory. Can listen to unicode of a key ('any' key on keyboard) or for a character (from 'a' to 'z').
    Author:
    csiki

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int key
      Unicode of the last typed key.
      private int keyExpected
      Unicode of the expected key.
      private core.KeyReader keyReader
      KeyReader instance to subscribe to it.
      private boolean keyTyped
      True if the expected key is already typed.

      • KeyTyped

        public KeyTyped(char keyExpected,
        core.KeyReader keyReader)
        Constructor of KeyTyped (where char passed).
        Parameters:
        keyExpected - expected character to be typed
        keyReader - to store KeyReader instance

      • KeyTyped

        public KeyTyped(int keyExpected,
        core.KeyReader keyReader)
        Constructor of KeyTyped (where unicode passed).
        Parameters:
        keyExpected - expected unicode of the key to be typed
        keyReader - to store KeyReader instance

    • Method Detail

      • keyTypedLast

        public int keyTypedLast()
        Gets the unicode of the last key typed, if KeyTyped is activated, and has not been deactivated. If deactivated it returns the last key typed when activated.
        Returns:
        unicode of the last key typed

      • isKeyTyped

        public boolean isKeyTyped()
        Gets if the expected key is typed.
        Returns:
        true if the expected key has been already typed, false otherwise.

      • update

        public void update()
        KeyReader calls it if new key is hit. Behavior should NOT call it!
        Specified by:
        update in class UserAction

      • activate

        public void activate(Behavior behavior)
        Activates KeyTyped, so it listens for key hits. Should be activated after created by behavior!
        Specified by:
        activate in class UserAction

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates KeyTyped, so it won't listen for key hits. Can be called by behavior but automatically called by itself if the expected key is hit (after activated ofc.).
        Specified by:
        deactivate in class UserAction
